*The schedule below is provisional and subject to change depending on 
weather and instructor availability.*



```{r,echo=FALSE,message=FALSE,warning=FALSE}
dat<-xlsx::read.xlsx("_includes/course-schedule.xlsx" ,
    sheetName="lab-schedule",
    stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
dat$Date<-as.character(dat$Date)
dat$L1<-paste("Laboratory"," ",dat$Laboratory,"(",dat$Date,"): ",
    dat$L1,sep="")
x<-list()
for(i in na.omit(unique(dat$Laboratory)))
    {
    if(length(na.omit(dat[dat$Laboratory==i,]$L2))==0)
        {
        x[[i]]<- list(L1=dat[dat$Laboratory==i,]$L1[1])
        }else
        {
        x[[i]]<- list(L1=dat[dat$Laboratory==i,]$L1[1],
            L2=na.omit(dat[dat$Laboratory==i,]$L2))
        }
  
    }
```



```{r,echo=FALSE,results='asis'}
# level -1 drops indent so it does not 
# format as code...
pander::pandoc.list(x, indent.level = -1)

```

```{r,echo=FALSE,results='asis'}
dat<-xlsx::read.xlsx("_includes/course-schedule.xlsx" ,
    sheetName="lab-schedule",
    stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
dat$Date<-as.character(dat$Date)
dat$L1<-paste("Laboratory"," ",dat$Laboratory,"(",dat$Date,"): ",
    dat$L1,sep="")
x<-list()

h1<-unique(dat$L1[which(!is.na(dat$Date))])
for(i in  1:max(na.omit(dat$Laboratory)))
    {
    sub<- subset(dat,Laboratory==i)
    cat(paste0("### ", h1[i],sep=""))
    pander::pandoc.list(as.list(sub$L2))
    } 
```
